p: Grape, from the family Vitaceae, is one of the most respected fruits in TPM since it produces a series of physiologically balanced humors and thus, is recommended for the general population. In addition to its high nutritional value, modern pharmacological investigations have focused on the remarkable antioxidant properties of this fruit. This attention is due to polyphenolic compounds including proanthocyanidins in the flesh and resveratrol in the fruit seed/peel ( Nassiri-Asl and Hosseinzadeh, 2016). Intriguingly, it is emphasized in TPM to take grape with its seed for the urologic problems, showing the knowledge of Persian physicians about the specific effects of the seeds.
